revised_title: Sustained Temperature Oscillations in Chemical Reactors: Theory and Experiment
tldr: The authors observed and analyzed sustained temperature oscillations in a chemical reactor during the chlorination of methyl chloride. They found that the oscillations were reproducible and predictable within a specific range of reaction temperatures. A mathematical analysis of the reacting system closely predicted the nature, frequency, and range of the oscillations, providing insights into the dynamics of the system and potential improvements in temperature control.
